# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/requests/status_codes.py
@source-hash: 889500780db96da4
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:00:46Z

## Purpose
HTTP status code mapping module that provides human-readable names for status codes, accessible as both attributes and dictionary keys. Part of the requests library's internal vendor package.

## Key Components

### Data Structure
- **`_codes` (L23-104)**: Core dictionary mapping HTTP status codes to tuples of human-readable aliases
  - Comprehensive coverage: informational (1xx), success (2xx), redirection (3xx), client error (4xx), server error (5xx)
  - Multiple aliases per code (e.g., 200 has "ok", "okay", "all_ok", "âœ“", etc.)
  - Includes creative aliases like "\\o/" for 200, "-o-" for 404, "/o\\" for 500

### Main Export
- **`codes` (L106)**: LookupDict instance providing the public interface
  - Allows both attribute and dictionary access patterns
  - Case-insensitive lookups supported

### Initialization
- **`_init()` (L109-126)**: Module initialization function
  - Populates the `codes` object with attributes for each status name
  - Creates both lowercase and uppercase versions (L114) except for special symbols
  - Dynamically generates module docstring with all available codes (L121-125)
  - Called immediately at module load (L128)

## Dependencies
- **LookupDict** from `.structures`: Custom dictionary-like class enabling both attribute and key access

## Architecture Notes
- Lazy documentation generation: module docstring built dynamically from the status code mappings
- Flexible access patterns: `codes.ok`, `codes['ok']`, `codes.OK` all work
- Extensive alias system accommodates different naming preferences and legacy compatibility

## Usage Patterns
The module enables intuitive status code access:
```python
codes.ok                    # 200
codes['not_found']         # 404  
codes.internal_server_error # 500
```
